DataElement.preferredName: Recurrent Or Progressive Disease or Disorder Detection Chromosome Banding Fluorescence in situ Hybridization Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The return of a disease after a period of remission._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._A disease process that is increasing in scope or severity._Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._The activity of perceiving, discerning, discovering or identifying._The treatment of chromosomes to reveal characteristic patterns of horizontal bands.  The banding patterns lend each chromosome a distinctive appearance so the 22 pairs of human nonsex chromosomes and the X and Y chromosomes can be identified and distinguished without ambiguity. Banding also permits the recognition of chromosome deletions (lost segments), chromosome duplications (surplus segments) and other types of structural rearrangements of chromosomes. (MedicineNet.com)_A physical mapping approach that uses fluorescent tags to detect hybridization of probes within metaphase chromosomes or less condensed somatic interphase chromatin. This technique can be used for identification of chromosomal abnormalities and for gene mapping._The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Recurrent Disease Or PD Disease or Disorder
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: the return of a sign, symptom, or disease after a remission.:Or; used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:Cancer that is increasing in scope or severity.:Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Concepts.definition: The return of a disease after a period of remission.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredName: Detection Chromosome Banding Fluorescence in situ Hybridization
Property.preferredDefinition: No value exists.:The treatment of chromosomes to reveal characteristic patterns of horizontal bands.  The banding patterns lend each chromosome a distinctive appearance so the 22 pairs of human nonsex chromosomes and the X and Y chromosomes can be identified and distinguished without ambiguity. Banding also permits the recognition of chromosome deletions (lost segments), chromosome duplications (surplus segments) and other types of structural rearrangements of chromosomes. (MedicineNet.com):A type of IN SITU HYBRIDIZATION in which target sequences are stained with fluorescent dye so their location and size can be determined using fluorescence microscopy. This staining is sufficiently distinct that the hybridization signal can be seen both in metaphase spreads and in interphase nuclei.

Concepts.definition: The act of perceiving, discerning, discovering, or identifying.

The treatment of chromosomes to reveal characteristic patterns of horizontal bands.  The banding patterns lend each chromosome a distinctive appearance so the 22 pairs of human non-sex chromosomes and the X and Y chromosomes can be identified and distinguished without ambiguity. Banding also permits the recognition of chromosome deletions (lost segments), chromosome duplications (surplus segments) and other types of structural rearrangements of chromosomes.

A physical mapping approach that uses fluorescent tags to detect hybridization of probes within metaphase chromosomes or less condensed somatic interphase chromatin. This technique can be used for identification of chromosomal abnormalities and for gene mapping.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

ReferenceDocuments.description: PerformedObservation.dateRange WHERE  DefinedObservation.nameCode = "assess disease status" AND PerformedDiagnosis.diseaseStatusCode = "relapse" OR "progression" AND PerformedObservation.methodCode = "FISH"
